Technique: HEWN; POLISHED; FORMED BY HAND; FAYENCE
Name: Necklace of beads
Description: This necklace comes from the excavations of J. Garstang at Abydos. It is composed of rounded beads of cornaline and amethyst. One also distinguishes three small stones of unequal shape, in the middle of the necklace, probably serving as amulets. The piece, which was remodeled from ancient beads, dates from the Middle Kingdom.
